Posts.Content: Hope4mom wrote: I am looking for some help and insight for my mom.  She was diagnosed in april 2002 with stage 1 breast cancer. she had 2 surgeries a lumpectomy and a sentinal node removal and disection.  she recieved 6½ weeks of radiation and thankfully has been cancer free ever since.  Recently (the last few months) she has started to get painful swelling in her breast and was diagnosed with lymphedema.  the problem is she is having a hard time getting any medical help or instuction as to what to do.  She was told to wear a compression bra and given some excercises to do daily and sent away.  she is having a really tough time with the compression bras they really hurt her -- they almost seem to be doing more harm than good. She is having a really hard time finding a compression bra that fits her well.  She is also having a really hard time finding any information on lymphedema in the breast.  Has anyone here had this.  She seems to be in the early stages - she has read that it can be reversable in the early stages. has anyone had any experience with this. I would appreciate any suggestions, insight or guidance you ladies can give us.  she is feeling so discouraged right now and I am trying my best to help her thru all of this. Thank you Log in to post a reply
